body: Hi I've been having problems with using the Analysis period component when I use the psychrometric chart tool for plotting the hour point in Fahrenheit. I am trying to plot out hourly point for each seasons of the year and it shows up exactly as I want it in SI units but as soon as I convert it to IP units, the points are plotted way above the psych chart curves. I attached the SI version that works and the end results along with the IP version that shows the error. Thanks, Ken [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/gkB0q9PO6*a4wxnXpgz9wt8Mf93YihkiJ*c67K2UJMsucZzqA5Fa9xhJ8dxU7lBRKgAXW604q93yWL04vzgi36Ix28b7tPXj/Seasonspsychchart.png)[](http://api.ning.com:80/files/gkB0q9PO6*YCCIySfJ4yOay34Xs*OQgCYjzIPBbcMFChOfFBv6lDqAsCHrAbJtccJdJS96yR5vpumf1IKJk5iGqwrpmiUBX2/Analysisperiod.png)
topic: Analysis Period error in Psych chart

replies.body: Hey can anyone help me try to fix this?

Hi Ken,



I ran into the same issue. My workaround is to only use °C instead of °F for my drybulb input. Doesn't fix the bug, but it appears to show the correct info.
